definition: (onom.) for the sound of horsehoofs
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
(coll.) to run off at the mouth/to jabber on
variant of 得瑟[de4 se5]

sentences.english: I count the time you have left me, every minute , every second .
sentences.chinese: 我一分種，一秒鐘地計算你離去嘚時間。

sentences.english: And i came to the world just to meet you .
sentences.chinese: 我是爲了你，纔來到這個世界上嘚。

sentences.english: I hope that he will win the game.
sentences.chinese: 莪剘望咃噲贏嘚這場笓賽。

sentences.english: She make a shambles of things.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情搞嘚一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: I always know you want heavens that lighting most star.
sentences.chinese: 苊壹直知道妳想要天丄那顆最亮嘚星星。

sentences.english: He heard you and have witnessed smooth growth.
sentences.chinese: 厛說您啝咃發展嘚葙當順利。

sentences.english: She make a mess of entities.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情搞嘚一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: I must change my appointment from Monday to Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 我不嘚不把約會從週一改到週四。

sentences.english: Treasure the things you can't obtain.
He always has a sleepy expression.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他總是一副懶洋洋嘚表情。

sentences.english: I get what I want happiness?
sentences.chinese: 莪能得到莪想要嘚幸福嗎？

sentences.english: She make a muddle of things.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情搞嘚一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: I ascertain classical concerts more to my hobby than rock concerts.
sentences.chinese: 我斍嘚古典音樂會比搖滾音樂會更合我胃口。

sentences.english: The horse clattered along the hard, frozen road.
sentences.chinese: 馬在堅硬凍結的路上嘚嘚地跑過。

sentences.english: The horse clattered along the hard, frozen road.
sentences.chinese: 馬在堅硬凍結的路上嘚嘚地跑過。

definition: (modal particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la1])
neigh/whinny (sound made by a horse)
(interj. of disapproval)
(interj. of regret)
(used in place names)
suck
eh?
to suck/to incite
funny/amusing/sth comical
old variant of 狠[hen3]/old variant of 很[hen3]/also used as an exclamation of anger
move the mouth as in speaking
a noise/a sound
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
da! (sound used to move animals along)
sentence-final particle similar to 了[le5], but carrying a tone of approval
variant of 啖[dan4]
zedoary (Curcuma zedoaria), plant rhizome similar to turmeric
to stumble/to slip/variant of 達|达[da2]
